title: 10 Tips to Avoid Wearing Braces Longer Than Necessary

steps.title: Keep your mouth clean.
steps.content: Keep your mouth clean. Better dental hygiene can allow your teeth to move into the correct position more quickly.

steps.title: Chop up solid foods.
steps.content: Chop up solid foods. Cutting up foods like raw veggies, fruits, and crusty bread reduces pressure on your braces while eating and prevents them from being damaged.

steps.title: Don’t eat hard or sticky foods.
steps.content: Don’t eat hard or sticky foods. They can damage your braces and also cause tooth decay. Foods to avoid include: Popcorn Nuts Chips Bubblegum Toffee Caramels Cookies

steps.title: Stay away from soda or other carbonated beverages.
steps.content: Stay away from soda or other carbonated beverages. They can damage your teeth, which may mean more time in braces.

steps.title: Don’t chew on ice cubes.
steps.content: Don’t chew on ice cubes. Doing so can damage your braces or your teeth.

steps.title: Don’t chew on things like pens or straws.
steps.content: Don’t chew on things like pens or straws. It can damage your braces. Keep anything that isn’t food out of your mouth.

steps.title: Break habits like biting your nails or playing with the elastics on your braces.
steps.content: Break habits like biting your nails or playing with the elastics on your braces. Both activities can push your teeth out of line, increasing the amount of time you have to spend in braces. [Image:Get Your Braces off Faster Step 12.jpg|center]]

steps.title: Download an app.
steps.content: Download an app. Research shows that orthodontics apps help people take better care of their teeth. [2] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Just look up “orthodontics app”.

steps.title: Consider using an electric toothbrush for 15 minutes a day.
steps.content: Consider using an electric toothbrush for 15 minutes a day. A recent study shows this might speed tooth movement and reduce time in braces. [3] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Do as your orthodontist tells you.
steps.content: Do as your orthodontist tells you. The time required for braces to do their work varies from person to person, depending on the severity of the problem; the amount of space available on your jaw; the distance the teeth must travel; the health of your mouth; and how closely the patient follows instructions. [4] X Research source [5] X Expert Source Lewis Chen, DDS, FICOI, FIADFE Licensed Dentist Expert Interview. 11 May 2021. That last bit is where you come in!

steps.title: Start early.
steps.content: Start early. Children should have their first orthodontic screening at age 7, to check for potential problems. It is best to start with braces as soon as the permanent teeth are in place, which may be as early as 10 or 11 in girls and as late as 13 or 14 in boys. The less mature the teeth, jaws, and facial muscles, the more rapidly treatment can be accomplished, meaning less time in braces.

steps.title: Consider aligner therapy (ALT) instead of conventional edgewise braces (CEB).
steps.content: Consider aligner therapy (ALT) instead of conventional edgewise braces (CEB). Metal, edgewise braces involve bonding stainless steel metal to your teeth to apply precise forces that move them into place. Aligners are a clear, strong plastic material fabricated to fit each person’s mouth. Like conventional metal braces, they work by exerting pressure over time. Unlike metal braces, you will go through a series of aligners, wearing each one for three weeks. [6] X Research source Aligners are less obtrusive and studies show they reduce time in braces. [7] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Aligner braces are more expensive. Depending on your particular situation, they may reduce time in braces by only a small amount, or not at all, so consult your orthodontist before deciding which braces you will choose. [8] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Unlike metal braces, aligners can be taken out, which is great for photo ops, etc. However, they must be worn at least 20 hours a day to be effective. If you are worried about your child wearing them enough, you may want to opt for metal braces. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Consider accelerated orthodontic treatment if you are an adult.
steps.content: Consider accelerated orthodontic treatment if you are an adult. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Because adults have more developed teeth and jaws, teeth take longer to move. Low laser therapy and corticotomy, [11] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source [12] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source as well as micro-osteoperforation [13] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source have all been shown to reduce treatment times in adults. Low laser therapy involves directing short bursts of low-frequency light at the jaw in order to increase the production of osteoclasts, cells that demineralize bony block in the jaw, thereby speeding tooth movement. It also reduces pain. [14] X Research source Corticotomy involves making small cuts to the bone around the tooth in order to greatly speed movement. It is often combined with alveolar grafting (grafting demineralized bone over the cuts) in a technique called Accelerated Osteogenic Orthodontics. It has been shown to reduce the time of treatment by up to one third. [15] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source Micro osteoperforation is similar to corticotomy, accept that a tool is used to make much smaller perforations in the bone. This increases the production of osteoclasts, helping to demineralize hard bone and promote movement. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Consult your orthodontist to discuss the pros and cons of various treatments.
steps.content: Consult your orthodontist to discuss the pros and cons of various treatments. Be wary of Acceledent – a much-promoted device, which creates micro-vibrations that are intended to speed tooth movement. It is very expensive, and recent clinical studies indicate that Acceledent does not shorten time in braces. [17] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source
